Gondolier

Oct 10, 2010

Poetry poems

Pictures in frames,
taken in the days of their courtship,
were taken down and placed in a drawer
as keepsakes.

In the room where she would spend her nights alone
remained a black and white photograph
of a Venetian gondolier.
His company would keep her
in the dark hours of the morning.

In the room, where her lover slept,
she sometimes glimpsed, in
his sleeping face,
the younger man of years before.
She felt
gratitude
for their life together.

She returned, though,
frequently,
to the gondolier,
imagining what might be revealed,
should he,
someday,
pass out of
their river of shadows.
